text: Actually, good student that he is, Mueller requested an extension on the first day of class -- professor just forgot to make note of it.
author: RodgerPayne

text:
Good thread.

I jumped in mid-stream (awkwardly): https://twitter.com/RodgerPayne/status/1107636893238341632 …
author: RodgerPayne

text: Does Canada have the problem US apparently does: that the security services are a home for the white nationalists?
author: RodgerPayne

text: Though I guess with shared PRISM-related programs (SIGAD?), Canada, US, New Zealand, UK and Australia already collect and could theoretically evaluate all sorts of raw data from everyday people.
author: RodgerPayne

text:
No worries. Probably should have led with that.

These transnational linkages among hate-filled right-wing extremists are quite worrisome. But as you say, that doesn't mean we want national intelligence services closely monitoring universe of "everyday people."
author: RodgerPayne

text:
Sorry, wasn't trying to say that. 

The take in your thread is excellent and nuanced. 

In contrast, US leadership is clumsy and frightening.
author: RodgerPayne

text:
A top US decision-maker with access to the best intelligence was asked about difficulty of sorting out white supremacists/nationalists, neo-Nazis, and...cultural preservationists. Plus alt-left.

He pointed out that there were "some very fine people on both sides.”
author: RodgerPayne

text:
Some hyperbole in these quotes, but man, seems like another easy reason to hate Duke beyond college hoops. 

As a Jayhawk grad living in Louisville-Kentucky-Indiana triangle, with a daughter at UNC, I've discovered that all major fan bases are united against Duke.
author: RodgerPayne

text: Kevin Primus, a former manager of the Duke men’s basketball team, said the rejection of the light-rail plan justified the school’s reputation among African Americans who still occasionally refer to the university as “the plantation.”
author: RodgerPayne

text:
Re: Duke. "Wib Gulley, a former mayor of Durham, compared it to the moment when Duke called in the police 'to gas and beat students' amid civil rights protests in 1969."

Durham Dreamed of a Transit Line. Duke University All but Killed It.
author: RodgerPayne

text:
Congratulations Geoff (and Ken).

What about fall adoptions? Technically, our textbook orders were due Friday March 15...
author: RodgerPayne

text: I blogged about updates on my America First Project: https://rpayne.blogspot.com/2019/03/america-first-project-update.html?spref=tw …
author: RodgerPayne
